Key Match Events: Josh Little was the star with the ball early on, he was unplayable with late swing and plenty of seam movement.
Andy Balbirnie scored 62 runs off 47 balls.
Liam Livingstone took 3 wickets for 17 runs.
Mark Wood took 3 wickets for 34 runs.
Ireland won the match by 5 runs via the DLS method.
Pre-Game Insights: England captain Jos Buttler predicted that his team would let Ireland get away with runs in the first 10 overs.
England was expected to play by the DLS RR when batting second.
Post-Match Reflections: Andy Balbirnie said the win was amazing and emotional, and that it would ignite a future generation of Irish cricketers.
Jos Buttler said that Ireland outplayed England and that his team made a mistake by letting them get away with runs.
Ireland captain Andy Balbirnie mentioned that they were disappointed with losing seven wickets in a heap late in their innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in rainy conditions, with the rain getting heavier towards the end.
The match was delayed due to rain, and the umpires took the players off the field at one point.
Ireland's win was their first in the T20 World Cup, and it was a historic day for Irish cricket.
